title: App crash when open Status after it was put on background with Android hardware 'Back' button

labels.name: core-ui-grooming
labels.description: To be reviewed on the next core ui grooming to add the issue to team board and set priority

body: ***Type***: Bug ***Summary***: When user taps upon Android hardware 'Back' button being on Chats main view Status is put on the background. However, opening Status again results in an app crash with error `java.lang.illegalArgumentException: No view found for id 0x5ff (unknown) for fragment ScreenFragment{478dd37 #0 id=0x5ff}` #### Expected behavior User end up on Chats view after opening Status if it was put on background with Android hardware 'Back' button before #### Actual behavior Status crashes after open if it was put on background with Android hardware 'Back' button before ### Reproduction - Open Status and create new account - Staying on Chats main view tap Android hardware `Back` button - Open Status from the list of running apps (or via Status icon in the list of apps) ### Additional Information - Status version: Release/Develop 0.14 ( - Operating System: Android #### Logs ``` 08-06 13:23:22.738 354 354 W ResourceType: No package identifier when getting name for resource number 0x00000629 08-06 13:23:22.739 354 354 E FragmentManager: No view found for id 0x629 (unknown) for fragment @siphiuel are you working on this issue?
@Serhy Could not reproduce this on latest develop. Both when opening from task list, and via clicking on the app icon.

@Serhy Could reproduce it on a real device using the nightly as well! I've tried on emulator before. However, it does not happen to me always - sometimes clicking on an app from task list goes well without errors.

Pushed a tentative "fix" for this in https://github.com/status-im/status-react/pull/8868. Seems that it is caused by the react-native-screens library we use for smoother animations. Will try some alternative approaches.

Not reproducible anymore with the latest develop build (nightly October 01). 
Thanks @siphiuel ! Closing the issue.
